pull.title: Enable paranoid corruption checks in LevelDB >= 1.16
pull.body: It should be tested how well this responds to various types of corruption, but I'm submitting it as a pull request to give exposure.

events.message: Enable paranoid corruption checks in LevelDB >= 1.16

events.body:
Paranoid is good.

Maybe add it as an option first for now before we enable it in general? What is the biggest risk here, to have false positives with regard to corruption?

issue.title: Push cs_main locks down in ProcessBlock
issue.body: For now, built on top of #3884.

events.body:
Basically, yes. The fix in 1.16 is a case of something that LevelDB would consider corruption in paranoid mode, but is both hard to avoid (machines do crash...) and harmless (logfiles are append-only anyway). Perhaps there are other cases like these.

On the other hand, I prefer detecting corruption as early as possible...

issue.title: New block database files platform-dependent?
issue.body:
I compiled the content of the git tag 0.8-rc1 on my raspberry pi (ARM) and downloaded the blockchain (well most of it) into the new format.
When I try to copy the contents of blocks and chainstate an x86 machine and start the precompiled 0.8-rc1 bitcoind it crashes. Same happens with pi-created block chain files if you try to start the 0.8-rc1 windows.
(Copying the datafiles between x86 and ARM was no problem with 0.7)

events.body:
Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/p4177_cd01a5e18507c09eb6bbf159418e29c28fd3cadb/ for binaries and test log.
This test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/current/
Contact BlueMatt on freenode if something looks broken.
I've tested this for almost a month on some nodes. No spurious corruption errors. ACK.

On a non-broken system I don't expect this to ever trigger.

It's more in cases with crashing nodes/hardware, ...
Yes, but if there is actual corruption it _should_ trigger. So making it more sensitive here can only be better, or not?
Fair enough. I guess we'll see if it actually causes problems for anyone.
ACK. We can back this out before the next release if we decide we don't like it having it in master will help us find other issues.

issue.title: Windows client can't handle sudden shutdown or system reboot
issue.body: If client is running in Windows and system experiences a hard reboot or shutdown, the entire block chain needs to be re-downloaded next time application is launched.
